documentation.text:
@title MultiTokenForwardingRulesManager
 @dev Multi token mediator functionality for managing destination AMB lanes permissions.

attributes.text:
@title MultiTokenForwardingRulesManager
 @dev Multi token mediator functionality for managing destination AMB lanes permissions.

devdoc.details: Multi token mediator functionality for managing destination AMB lanes permissions.

destinationLane(address,address,address).details: Tells the destination lane for a particular bridge operation by checking several wildcard forwarding rules.

params._receiver: address of the tokens receiver on the foreign side of the bridge.
params._sender: address of the tokens sender on the home side of the bridge.
params._token: address of the token contract on the foreign side of the bridge.

returns._0: destination lane identifier, where the message should be forwarded to.  1 - oracle-driven-lane should be used.  0 - default behaviour should be applied. -1 - manual lane should be used.

getModuleInterfacesVersion().details: Tells the module interface version that this contract supports.

params._enable: true, if bridge operations for a given token and receiver should be forwarded to the manual lane.
params._receiver: address of the tokens receiver on the foreign side of the bridge.
params._token: address of the token contract on the foreign side.

params._enable: true, if all bridge operations to a given receiver should be forwarded to the oracle-driven lane.
params._receiver: address of the tokens receiver on the foreign side.

params._enable: true, if bridge operations for a given token and sender should be forwarded to the manual lane.
params._sender: address of the tokens sender on the home side of the bridge.
params._token: address of the token contract on the foreign side.

params._enable: true, if all bridge operations from a given sender should be forwarded to the oracle-driven lane.
params._sender: address of the tokens sender on the home side.

params._enable: true, if bridge operations for a given token should be forwarded to the oracle-driven lane.
params._token: address of the token contract on the foreign side.

transferOwnership(address).details: Changes the owner of this contract.

devdoc.title: MultiTokenForwardingRulesManager

setReceiverExceptionForTokenForwardingRu.notice: Allows a particular address to receive bridged tokens from the manual lane for a particular token. Only owner can call this method.

setReceiverForwardingRule(address,bool).notice: Updates the forwarding rule for the specific receiver. Only owner can call this method.

setSenderExceptionForTokenForwardingRule.notice: Allows a particular address to send bridge requests to the manual lane for a particular token. Only owner can call this method.

setSenderForwardingRule(address,bool).notice: Updates the forwarding rule for the specific sender. Only owner can call this method.

setTokenForwardingRule(address,bool).notice: Updates the forwarding rule for bridging specific token. Only owner can call this method.
